thread.title: Sergio Aguero's Future Could Take A Huge Twist After Latest Reports
thread.title_full: Sergio Aguero's Future Could Take A Huge Twist After Latest Reports

title: Sergio Aguero's Future Could Take A Huge Twist After Latest Reports
text:
Sergio Aguero's Future Could Take A Huge Twist After Latest Reports Thu Feb 02 2017 21:40:56   21:40:56   Jack Kenmare in football 
Until now, Sergio Aguero hasn't faced a tremendous amount of competition when it comes to a place in the Manchester City starting eleven. 
But following the arrival of Gabriel Jesus from Palmeiras earlier this month, it looks like the Argentinian may face a spell on the bench. 
Jesus has began life under Pep Guardiola with a bang. The 19-year-old has been involved in 3 goals in his first 3 games, and as a result of his fine form, Sergio Aguero was benched against West Ham on Wednesday. 
According to The Mirror, Spanish giants Real Madrid have picked up on Aguero's situation at Manchester City and are ready to make a bid to sign the player. 
Real Madrid are reportedly ready to offload both Karim Benzema and Alvaro Morata in the summer to make way. 
Los Blancos have been linked with Aguero for some time now, but if the 28-year-old's faces more time out of the Manchester City starting line-up, then a move to Real Madrid is arguably more likely than ever before. 
The Mirror also report that Juventus and Paris Saint Germain could also be interested in signing the forward. 
Should Aguero leave or does he have more to give at Manchester City? 
Let us know your thoughts. Sponsored Links
